title.narrative: World Bank, 2009 - 2017, Transitional Demobilization & Reintegration Program II
World Bank, 2009 - 2017, Transitional Demobilization & Reintegration Program II

description.narrative:
TDRP är en efterföljare till Världsbankens demobilseringsprogram i Stora Sjöregionen, MDRP, som ägde rum 2002-2009, och som Sverige var med och finansierade med sammanlagt 60 MSEK. TDRP har vidareutvecklats i samråd med olika partners varibland Sverige varit mycket aktiv i dialogen i syfte att ta tillvara MDRPs erfarenheter och "lessons learned" och bidra till att få en större regional ansats. Programmet syftar till att stödja D&R aktiviteter både nationellt men också regionalt. Sverige har hittills bidragit till TDRP med 15 MSEK. Mot bakgrund av den säkerhetspolitiska situationen i regionen och närliggande regioner har programmet förlängts och delvis expanderat i och med att dess tjänster inom området har efterfrågats av nya aktörer. Ytterligare medel behöver då tillföras och Sverige har tillfrågats om att bidra med 10 MSEK. Hittills uppgår programmets totala budget 2010-2014 till 33.7 MUSD. AfDB, Sverige, Finland, Norge, Kanada och Italien stödjer programmet.
TDRP is the successor to the World Bank's D&R program in the Great Lakes region, MDRP, which took place in 2002-2009, and that Sweden was co-funding with a total of 60 MSEK. TDRP has been developed in consultation with partners, among which Sweden has been very active in the dialogue in order to take advantage of MDRP's experiences and "lessons learned" in order to contribute to a wider regional approach. The program aims to support D & R activities both nationally but also regionally. Sweden has so far contributed to TDRP with 15 MSEK. In light of the security situation in the region and neighboring regions, the program has been extended and partially expanded, in that its services in the field have called for new stakeholders. Additional funds will then be needed and Sweden has been requested to contribute 10 MSEK. So far, the total program budget 2010-2014 amounts to 33.7 MUSD. AfDB, Sweden, Finland, Norway, Canada and Italy support the program.

The Transitional Demobilization and Reintegration Program (TDRP) is a regional programme financed by a multidonor trust fund (African Development Bank (AfDB), Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Italy, Norway and Sweden) aiming to enhance the prospects for stabilization and recovery in the Great Lakes Region, GLR, by supporting demobilization and reintegration (D&R) and related activities.

The Transitional Demobilization and Reintegration Program (TDRP) is a regional program financed by a multi-donor trust fund (African Development Bank (AfDB), Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Italy, Norway and Sweden) aiming to enhance the prospects for stabilization and recovery in the Great Lakes region by supporting demobilization and reintegration (D&R) and related activities. The TDRP aims to support the Disarmament & Reintegration (D&R) of ex-combatants and related activities in the Great Lakes region of Africa. The ultimate strategic objective of these activities is to enhance the prospects for stabilization and recovery in the GLR. Specific program objectives are: a. To support the successful implementation of existing D&R programs in the region through the provision of financial and technical support; b. To expand D&R programming coverage by providing emergency response financing for new or ongoing D&R operations where funding gaps have been identified and the Government concerned has requested assistance; and c. To facilitate a platform for dialogue, information exchange and learning on D&R in the sub-region with a view to addressing the regional aspects of conflict, improving the quality of on-going D&R efforts, reducing duplication of efforts across the GLR, strengthening coordination on D&R policy and programming, and generating policy advice for future programs. d. Enhance the capacity of African leadership to respond to (DDR) needs through operational, technical, and knowledge managemnet capacity building

participating-org.narrative: IBRD/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development/The World Bank

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: TDRP has demonstrated positive results across all areas of the programme, including progress on enhancing institutional and organizational capacity of the African Union (AU) through the AU Disarmament, Demobilization and Reintegration (DDR) Capacity Program, and through other activities, the program has positively affected lives of over 200,000 ex-combatants. TDRP has been relevant to the needs of the countries supported as well as to donor priorities and the broader work of the World Bank in fragile countries and states. In particular, the Technical Assistance of TDRP has been suited to the needs of national commissions as the assistance delivered has met the needs identified by national commissions. It also provided some standardized approaches to Monitoring and Evaluation and Management Information Systems in the Great Lakes Region. Additionally, TDRP’s work has successfully contributed to the Research, Knowledge and Learning objective of the World Bank and donor expectations. It has been noted in the TDRP donor committee meetings that the TDRP implementation period (2009-2017) has seen growing recognition that DDR activities are just one of many elements required for successful peace and stabilization process, and that they are associated in multifaceted ways to peace negotiations, to justice and security sector reform, and both peace-building and state-building. This is particularly important in contexts in which an increasing number of DDR activities take place outside a formal peace process, and in many cases, occur in contexts in which there is no legitimate government - or a government with severe capacity constraints. This reinforces the role of DDR as one of a larger nexus of activities within the broader peace building and stabilization context. It should be noted that whilst all results showcased in the completion memo are associated with the TDRP portfolio, not all the deliverable or outputs were directly funded by the TDRP trust fund.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
